questions.text: Stab knife which is used commonly for incision and drainage is which number ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Surgical knife number 11 : Used for arteriotomy and incision and drainage Surgical knife number 15 : Used for minor surgical procedures, plastic and pediatric surgery Surgical knife number 22: Abdominal incisions Surgical knife number 23: For very thick skin

questions.text: What is the gauge of green IV Cannula ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: What is the size of orange foley's catheter ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: What has been shown in the following figure ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) It is skin stapler. Linear stapler used in bowel anastomosis. Circular stapler is used in haemorrhoidopexy , Low anterior resection in CA rectum.

choices.text: Tip of nose to ear to xiphisternum
Tip of nose to angle of ear to umbilicus
Mouth to ear to midway between xiphisternum and umbilicus

questions.text: How to measure nasogastric tube length ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Length of Nasogastric tube required is measured by measuring the distance from the tip of nose to ear lobule to xiphisternum.

questions.text: What is the preferred position for nasogastric tube insertion?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Preferred position for Nasogastric tube insertion is Sitting.

questions.text: Following instrument is used to remove stone in ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The above figure is of lithotrite, used in cystolitholopexy that is per urethral removal of small stones from urinary bladder.

questions.text: What is the name of this drain ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) This figure shows a romovac suction drain it is most commonly used after Modified Radical Mastectomy. Option B. Jackson-Pratt drain (also called a JP drain) is a closed-suction medical device that is commonly used as a post-operative drain for collecting bodily fluids from surgical sites. The device consists of an internal drain connected to a grenade-shaped bulb via plastic tubing.

questions.text: What is the most common complication while inserting the following catheter ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The above figure shows a central venous catheter. Most common complication while inserting this is pneumothorax. Most common catheter related complication is catheter related sepsis.

questions.text: The correct procedure of inserting the following equipment in the image given below:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The given image shows nasogastric tube,also known as Ryle's tube. Length measurement of nasogastric tube - from Tip of nose to earlobe to xiphisternum. For insertion,Patient should be sitting comfortably with slight flexion of neck. This is not done in supine position as patient may vomit and there is risk of aspiration in supine position.

questions.text: Color code of 16F Foley's catheter is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Fr is outer diameter and 1mm=3 Fr. The colour coding of different foley's catheter is given below:- Green-14fr Orange-16fr Red-18fr Yellow-20fr

questions.text: What is the instrument shown in the below picture?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The given image shows Chemoport,which is placed in central vein [ subclavian >>internal jugular].A chemo port is a small, implantable reservoir with a thin silicone tube that attaches to a vein. The main advantage of this vein-access device is that chemotherapy medications can be delivered directly into the port rather than a vein, eliminating the need for needle sticks.

questions.text: What is the utility of the instrument shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The given image shows Veress needle.It is a Spring loaded needle with 14G capacity.It is used to create pneumoperitoneum. Position of patient=slight head down 2 clicks are heard while putting this needle=1st when it pierces the fascia and 2nd when it pierces the peritoneum To confirm position=do saline drop test or aspirate method. In patients with previous midline scars,Veress needle is not put as it can cause injury to bowel/ vessel.In this case-open technique is used.

questions.text: Identify the drain shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Mini vac drain is designed for low pressure suction of post-operative wounds. Option B-Romovac is a closed drain. Option C-The given image shows a Closed drainage system known as Jackson Pratt drain. Option D-Corrugated rubber drain→ open type

questions.text: Identify the cannula size?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 16G=GREY 18G=GREEN 20G=PINK 22G=BLUE

choices.text: Tip of the nose to ear lobule to between manubrium sternum and umbilicus
Angle of mouth to ear lobule to xiphisternum
Tip of the nose to the angle of the mandible to the xiphisternum
Tip of the nose to ear lobule to the xiphisternum

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct method for measurement of NG tube?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Tip of the nose to ear lobule to the xiphisternum is the correct method for measurement of NG tube in adults. Tip of the nose to ear lobule to the midpoint between umbilicus and xiphisternum is the correct method for measurement of NG tube in infants.

questions.text: A patient underwent mastectomy and a drain was inserted beneath the flap. What type of drain is it?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The given image shows Romovac drain.It is a Closed type of drain. It is removed when output from drain is <30 ml in 24 hours for 2 consecutive days.

questions.text: Which instrument is not used in management of Upper GI bleed?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Image A is Modified Sengenstaken Blakemore tube Image B is Minnesota tube Image C is Upper GI endoscope Image D is simple bronchoscope,which obviously is not used in management of Upper GI bleed.

questions.text: The given instrument is used for which of the following procedure?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The given instrument is used for PEG (percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy) tube placement.

choices.text: Continuous lesions rather than segmented lesions
Associated with increased risk of developing cancer
Less likely to present with daily hematochezia

questions.text: In comparison to ulcerative colitis, crohn's is associated with
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-crohn's has more segmented lesions rather than continuous lesions. Option B-Crohn's is Associated with less risk of developing cancer. Option C-Crohn's has more risk of perianal fistulas. Option D-Crohn's is Less likely to present with daily hematochezia.

questions.text: The instrument given in the image is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Jackson-Pratt drain The given Image is of a Jackson-Pratt drain.

questions.text: After which procedure will you use the tube shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Choledochotomy The image shows Kehr’s T tube used after choledochotomy. The horizontal limb is placed in the common bile duct while the vertical limb is brought out like a drain.

questions.text: Identify the instrument
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Kocher forceps The given image is that of Kocher forceps. It can be Identified by the presence of serrations in the blade and apposing tooth in the tips. It is used to hold the gauze for blunt dissection, to hold the resected bowel, and to hold the ribs during rib resection.

questions.text: What instrument is required for the following procedure?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Cystourethroscope The instrument required for placing the Double J stent (DJ stent), as shown in the radiograph is a cystourethroscope. Cystourethroscopy allows for the examination and access of the bladder and urethra, which is crucial for guiding the DJ stent from the bladder into the ureter. This procedure involves inserting a flexible or rigid endoscope through the urethra and into the bladder, where the stent can be manoeuvred into the ureter.

questions.text: During an ongoing cholecystectomy surgery, the surgeon instructs the intern to retract the liver. Which of the following instruments should be used?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Deaver retractor A Deaver retractor is used to retract the liver during surgery. It is commonly used during cholecystectomy. The liver can still be damaged while using this retractor, so care must be taken to avoid using excessive force. Some surgeons prefer to reduce the risk of liver injury by placing an abdominal pack between the liver and retractor.

questions.text: Identify the instrument given in the image below:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Morris retractor The given image shows a Morris retractor with a single, flat transversely curved blade and a blunt projecting ridge with backward projection. Morris retractor can be single or double-bladed. It is used to retract abdominal wall incisions, loin incisions, subcostal wounds or any wounds in depth

questions.text: The instrument shown below is used for.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Creating pneumoperitoneum The given instrument is Veress Needle. It is used to produce a pneumoperitoneum in direct puncture laparoscopy.

questions.text: Identify the following instrument..
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Harmonic scalpel The instrument shown is a harmonic scalpel. It is an instrument that uses ultrasonic energy to cut tissues while simultaneously coagulating them. The scalpel vibrates in the 20000-50000 Hz range and cuts through tissues, achieving hemostasis by sealing vessels and tissues by means of protein denaturation using vibration rather than heat.

questions.text: Identify the following instrument?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Unipolar cautery The given instrument is a unipolar cautery/monopolar cautery.

questions.text: An intern uses the following instrument to catheterize the patient during his surgery postings. What is the size of the catheter used by the intern?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 18 F The instrument shown in the above image is Foley’s catheter. The presence of a red coloured ring in the balloon port indicates its size as 18 F. Catheter size is measured in the Charrière or French scale. The French scale refers to the external diameter of the catheter, and 1Fr is 0.3 mm in diameter. As a general rule, catheter size should be the smallest size that can accomplish the desired drainage (i.e., 12 to 14 Fr for clear urine and 20 to 24 for thick pus or blood-filled urine).

questions.text: The instrument shown below will be least useful for examining patients with which of the following conditions?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Acute anal fissure The given image shows a proctoscope. It is not used for examining patients with anal fissures. Due to pain, digital rectal examination and anoscopy are not performed immediately in an acute anal fissure. It is reserved for later when the symptoms resolve or the patient is in the operating room.

questions.text: A surgeon working in a community health centre notices that the following suture material shown in the image is the only suture available in stock for use. In which of the following conditions is this suture material not useful?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Hernia repair The suture material shown in the image is plain catgut which is a yellowish absorbable suture material and cannot be used in procedures like hernia repair that require prolonged support.

choices.text: To hold tough tissue like skin and fascia

questions.text: For what purpose would you use the instrument shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) To carry out blunt dissection The above image is of Lister’s sinus forceps which are used for blunt dissection. It is used during Hilton’s method of abscess drainage to break the bacterial locull. It is also used for inserting or removing packing in the sinus cavity.

questions.text: Name the instrument given below is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Czerny’s Retractor The given image shows Czerny’s retractor. Czerny’s Retractor is a double-ended retractor used to retract wound edges for intermediate-type procedures. One end has a blade with a lip which helps to retract without the edge slipping. The other end has two prongs and helps to retract the ends of an Incision

questions.text: Up to what length from the anal verge will you be able to visualize through a flexible sigmoidoscope?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) 60 cm Flexible sigmoidoscope is 60 cm in length and can be used to visualize the rectum and sigmoid colon.

questions.text: What is the size of the given blade used for incision and drainage of a superficial abscess?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The size of the surgical blade shown is the 11-size blade (stab knife) that has a triangular shape with an oblique edge and a sharp-pointed tip.

choices.text: Tip of nose to ear lobule to xiphisternum
Angle of mouth to tragus to xiphisternum
Ala of nose to angle of mandible to xiphisternum
Angle of mouth to ear lobule to umbilicus

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct method for measurement of nasogastric tube?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Tip of nose to ear lobule to xiphisternum The correct method for measuring a nasogastric tube (Ryle’s tube) is from the tip of the nose to the ear lobule to the xiphisternum. Nasogastric (NG) tubes play a role in treating intestinal obstruction and can also be used to provide nutritional support. The commonly used method to determine the length of a nasogastric tube (NG tube) is the NEX method, which involves measuring from the tip of the nose to ear to xiphisternum. The approximate length to be inserted is 55cms.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man undergoes pancreatic necrosectomy. The surgeon decides to place abdominal drains following the procedure. Which of the given suture materials is preferred for securing the drain externally?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Silk Silk sutures are commonly used to secure external drains. Silk is a blue/black-colored, multifilament, natural, braided, and non-absorbable suture material derived from the cocoon of the silkworm larva. Fibrous encapsulation of the suture occurs in 2 to 3 weeks, and it is absorbed slowly over 1 to 2 years.

questions.text: The following drain is placed after mastectomy. Identify the type of drain.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Closed The Romo Vac drain, depicted in the image, is a closed type of drain commonly used after mastectomy. Drains are placed at surgical sites to freely collect the air or fluids that may accumulate. This enhances wound healing by preventing the formation of unnecessary cavities. Drains are prophylactic in elective surgeries and therapeutic in emergency surgeries.

questions.text: During thyroidectomy, the given instrument was used to retract the strap muscles. Identify the instrument:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Langenbeck retractor The above image is that of a Langenbeck retractor. It is used for holding open wounds, as in an open appendicectomy.
